title: U.S.-Canada Border Opening Sends Snowbirds South
sub_head: Canadians are again driving to the U.S. to escape a harsh winter, and Florida and other states are eager to welcome them
body:
OTTAWAâ€”Shirley Parchoma and her husband, Bernie, were first-time Canadian snowbirds in February of last year when they last crossed the border into the U.S. in their 40-foot motor home, bound for Arizona and California.
Weeks later, the Parchomas returned to their northwestern Saskatchewan home because of the coronavirus pandemic.
